intro: Diasperus cyrtophyllus, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its compact growth and year-round foliage. Diasperus cyrtophyllus is also valued for its role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
